channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russia attacks Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-US talks
item.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between ...

item.title: Opinion: The best gift we can give the departed is to keep their sparkle alive
item.description: Christmastime is full of joy, sure, but also full of bittersweetness from nostalgia and loss. NPR's Scott Simon details a holiday encounter in his kit...

item.title: ADHD drugs may work indirectly to boost attention
item.description: Drugs like Adderall and Ritalin appear to help children with ADHD by activating brain areas involved in alertness and motivation.

item.title: Myanmar is set to hold phased elections. Here's why they're being called a 'sham'
item.description: Myanmar's military rulers are holding a general election in phases starting Dec. 28 amid the country's civil war. The head of the U.N. says the vote w...

item.title: Our top global photo stories from 2025: Fearless women, solo polar bear, healing soups
item.description: These stunning photos include a polar bear in a Chinese zoo, a teen in Zambia facing an uncertain future, Mongolian kids watching TV in a tent, a chef...

item.title: New York blanketed in snowfall, sparking travel chaos
item.description: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled and more than 3,000 were delayed by the winter storm.

item.title: Major snow storms threaten holiday travel
item.description: The Northeast saw heavy snow on Friday, impacting holiday plans and causing flight delays and cancellations.

item.title: Nine arrested in Italy for allegedly raising millions for Hamas
item.description: Police say the suspects raised around €7m (£6m) for the militant group over more than two years.

item.title: Deadly storms slam Southern California
item.description: Record rainstorms drenched Southern California this week, leaving residents without power during the holidays.

item.title: Four hikers found dead after avalanche in central Greece
item.description: A search operation was launched after three men and a woman went missing on Christmas Day.

item.title: Thousands without power in Kyiv after massive Russian attack
item.description: Authorities say a third of residents in the Ukrainian capital have been left without heating in freezing weather.

item.title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes
item.description: Almost one million people were displaced when hostilities resumed earlier this month after the first truce broke.

item.title: Trump says timing of Christmas Day strikes targeting ISIS in Nigeria was intentional
item.description: President Trump said Thursday's strikes on Nigeria targeting ISIS were set for Wednesday but were delayed to Christmas Day for symbolic reasons. Mr. T...

item.title: Rescuers search for soccer coach, children after boat sinks in Indonesia
item.description: The Spanish soccer club Valencia said that a coach for its women's reserve team, Fernando Martín, and three of his children were among the victims.

item.title: Flu cases skyrocket across the U.S.
item.description: Nearly five million flu cases have been reported nationwide, the CDC estimates, and at least 1,900 people have died from the virus. "CBS Saturday Morn...

item.title: Public release of Epstein records puts Ghislaine Maxwell under fresh scrutiny
New storm hitting waterlogged Southern California could bring mudslides and high surf
item.description: Another powerful storm system that could cause more flooding and mudslides is rolling across Southern California.
